abstract: Lobbyists for the nation’s biggest banks have persuaded federal regulators to soften a proposed Dodd-Frank rule, a move that is expected to protect Wall Street’s control over the $700 trillion derivatives market.
snippet: Lobbyists for the nation’s biggest banks have persuaded federal regulators to soften a proposed Dodd-Frank rule, a move that is expected to protect Wall Street’s control over the $700 trillion derivatives market.

headline.main: Big Banks Get Break in Rules to Limit Risks
headline.print_headline: Big Banks Get Break in Rules Limiting Risks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
